page.title: 01West side of Nidd Valley
page.content:
This is a very rural area with a small hamlet in one corner. Elsewhere inhabitants are limited to farms. The side of the valley rises to the west and as it rises it shows very definite changes. Nearest the bottom of the valley fields are small and bordered by dry stone walls, a feature of the area. Sheep and cattle graze the rough grass. There are a few small woods, mostly coniferous but with a few giving a golden colour in autumn. Several small valleys dissect the area & these have some deciduous trees in them forming a scattering. As the hillside rises the grass become more tusocky and yellow in colour until eventually higher up the side of the valley heather takes over ad open
moorland is apparent. The stone walls
